channel.title: fiction on Matthäus J. Mrozek

item.title: A Fracture, Jack, the Tank, Mother
item.description: A Fracture My little sister looks at me with a peculiar expression, holds two connected track pieces, and threatens to break them if I don’t pick her up. I suffer a hernia, but I still hold her. The Christ child focuses only on me. I don’t feel any pain. My mother chides, “Don’t kick your socks onto the wardrobe again!” I simply lose interest in playing with the toy train. Rather, I’m still enamored by the toy, but fear currently dominates my emotions.
